title: Historical Stock Price Performance of First Internet Bancorp During Significant Market Events

content.text: During the dotcom bubble burst in 2000, many internet companies experienced significant declines in their stock prices. First Internet Bancorp, being an internet-focused bank, also faced a downturn. Its stock price dropped from around $50 in early 2000 to below $5 by the end of the year.

content.section: Market Rally: Recovery from 2008 Financial Crisis
content.text: After the 2008 financial crisis, the overall market went through a period of recovery. First Internet Bancorp's stock price reflected this positive trend and showed a steady increase from around $3 in early 2009 to $17 by the end of 2010.

During the Great Recession, First Internet Bancorp's stock price also experienced a decline, like most financial institutions. It went from around $20 in early 2008 to less than $3 by early 2009, reflecting the impact of the economic downturn.

In 2020, the COVID-19 pandemic caused a sharp market downturn. However, First Internet Bancorp's stock price demonstrated resilience. After a temporary dip to around $15 in March 2020, it quickly rebounded and reached a new all-time high of over $45 by the end of the year, reflecting the bank's ability to adapt to changing market conditions.

During the global financial crisis in 2008, First Internet Bancorp's stock price faced significant volatility. It dropped from around $20 in early 2008 to below $4 in late 2008. The market crash greatly impacted the banking sector, including First Internet Bancorp.

While the COVID-19 pandemic had a negative impact on many industries, the tech sector experienced a surge in market interest. First Internet Bancorp, being an internet-focused bank, benefited from this trend. Its stock price climbed from around $20 in March 2020 to over $45 by the end of the year, reflecting the positive sentiment towards tech companies during the pandemic.
